website_summaries.verdict: A quality pair of insoles from Birkenstock designed to provide support and grip during athletic activity.
pros: Available in a broad range of sizes for men and women
Works with flat and low-heel shoes
Material has grip for sports activity
cons: They're pricey, and wide widths are not available

customer_reviews.title: Makes my fitness footwear as comfy as my Birkenstock Arizona
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide toe box, narrow heel and high arches. These insoles make my athletic shoes fit as comfortably as my Birkenstock sandlals. The cushy top layer provides great impact absorption and combined with the cork sole provides terrific arch support. I use these for weight lifting, running and carving my Trikke.
customer_reviews.author: Chernow

customer_reviews.title: Size up 1 from your Birkenstock Arizona size
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because honestly if I could live in my rubber Birkenstocks I would but I wanted to point out that the insole length was a little too short when ordering the same size as you would be in the Arizona sandal So if I was going to re order these I'd size up 1 Hope this helps people
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic! I put them in a pair of my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I put them in a pair of my Keen shoes and they've made a great difference. I did look at the Keen size chart to make sure I ordered the correct European size before ordering my Birkenstock inserts and they fit perfectly. They have been helping to relive the plantar fasciitis that flared up in my right foot.
customer_reviews.author: GRX

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pain releaf!!!
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Birkenstock sandals after years of trying a variety of inserts for as much as $600. When I found that I could purchase the same support for my sneakers as I have in my sandals, I was ecstatic. My foot pain has been drastically reduced. Also I use only the cork portion of these inserts and they work perfectly. I highly recommend these inserts.
customer_reviews.author: karen baker

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for sneaker insoles
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear Birkenstock shoes and sandals. These insoles are adaptable to other sneakers, provided you find a pair of sneakers with replaceable insoles. Most sneakers today seem to be made with glued-in insoles. I have a pair of old Reebok's that have replaceable insoles and I can wear them with these insoles. These Birkenstock insoles come with a hard plastic ankle support and are covered with a thin but sturdy foam-rubber like cover (as pictured) that can be cut to size if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Road Running
customer_reviews.text: Got me back running and helped massively with long standing Plantar Fascitis. I tried using many different configurations with the two included pieces, and for running, ended up not using the blue top piece, as my toebox would get too crowded. I removed my running shoes insoles and just used the cork based three quarter length piece. Worked well in my Brooks Launch and my Brooks Ghost, as well as my Asolo hiking shoes. Feels a bit odd at first, but I come home injury free. Shin Splints, Fascitis, hip pain, and foot soreness all or almost all gone. You may want to buy them from Birkenstock, as one set of insoles I got here were clearly used.
customer_reviews.author: platypus

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but sizing is wrong!
customer_reviews.text: The support from the Birko is good and the comfort cushioning is very good for tennis. However, the problem of universal fit rears its ugly. I bought these insoles to replace the Nike and Asics tennis shoe insoles, which don't have enough arch support. Unfortunately, the Birko insole is shorter than the indicated US M (11) on the Nike and Asics. Fortunately, it's wide enough not to slide but short enough notice very occasionally. I'm not sure going a size up is a good thing either. You can't cut it or reshape it because of the toe supports. It has to fit or not.
customer_reviews.author: Indignant US viewer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: My problem feet (plantar fasciitis and metatarsal problems) love Birkenstock sandals so I wanted to put their inserts into my sneakers and boots. I liked the idea of the full length cover for shoes so I decided to try this version as well as the Birko Natural Arch Support. I'm returning this pair because material seems to be some sort of plastic, not breathable and I cannot stand "plastic" inserts. the Birko Natural Arch Support are PERFECT! Keeping them and will order another set so I don't have to constantly swap back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: vicki

customer_reviews.title: One of the best off the shelf orthotics
customer_reviews.text: I have recommended and used hundreds of generic off the shelf orthotics for over 30 years of practice as a Chiropractic Physician. Sports at all levels, and what is missed with most is the fore arch, and most do not have one. This is a very comfortable out of the box ortho with little break in period. I have 4 sets I used in all my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: sweetannie

customer_reviews.title: Diabetic
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a gift of a 46 yr. old man with diabetes who suffers with foot pain in his construction job. He put it in his work boots and so far I have received 3 "thank you's" from him, telling me how they are just what he needed to help him through his work day. It is the best feeling to give something to someone that really has helped so much.
customer_reviews.author: campromise

customer_reviews.title: Birkenstock insoles allow you to wear almost any shoe,
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Birkenstock insoles for years and absolutely love and need them. I wear a 40 and a womans USA 10. My husband wears a 43 and a 10.5/11 USA. I find the conversion provided by Birkenstock to be incorrect. As far as particular models the Sport BRK-1001173 has a low to medium arch & 1.25mm thick heel where the Tradition BRK-1001157 has med to high arch & 1.75mm thick heel My husband prefers the Tradition BRK-1001157 over the sport.
customer_reviews.author: DPInc

customer_reviews.title: The first step to feeling better
customer_reviews.text: So glad I gave this a try! I've got Morton's neuroma, and this support is wonderful. I purchased an inexpensive pair of tennis shoes to put these Birko supports in, and this is the first time in months I could go for a walk without pain. I would recommend these to anyone having foot pain as their first step towards feeling better at a practical price.
customer_reviews.author: Fay Fink

customer_reviews.title: No more pain!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had already reviewed these! The first day I put these insoles in my walking shoes, I had NO knee or hip pain at all by evening. I thought it was too good to be true! I’ve been wearing them for several weeks now, with the same result! They’re fantastic. DO read the directions and take the current insoles out of your shoes before inserting these. They don’t fit in my dress boots, as those insoles don’t come out. Although these seem expensive, they’re worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: jenrob

customer_reviews.title: May need to order a few times to find the right size
customer_reviews.text: Birkenstocks have saved my feet, but it's difficult to get the right fit for these. The correct size is often smaller than your shoe size (and if you go too large these inserts will hurt!), but they won't fit properly if they're too much smaller than your shoes. For these inserts, I had to pick a size in-between my Birkenstock size and my shoe size. Then they fit well enough in my shoe without being too much arch support. I like that these replace the entire insole of your shoe---they're much smoother feeling than the half-size insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Preston

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but just giving it four stars as a placeholder until time gives me more data. I’m using these insoles for my composite toe work shoes. I love Birkenstock footbeds but opted out of their steel toed shoes due to poor rating and got these instead. Comfortable so far.
customer_reviews.author: amos

customer_reviews.title: Did not provide support for a physical work environment
customer_reviews.text: I put these in my work boots and they do not supply enough support or padding for my feet. My work is physical and requires heavy lifting all day long. So these may mold to my foot bed, then have nothing in support and comfort while being at work. Had to send the other two sets back for a refund, but I kept the pair I wore for my puttering around the house shoes. They seem to fill that role nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Walking pain free!
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling with plantar fasciitis for over a year, orthotic insoles my podiatrist prescribed were useless. Finally, i happened to purchase Birkenstock sandals, my wife wears them all the time, now I know why. I walked in Birkentstock sandels for several days and I feel almost no pain, it was amazing!!!!! Out of curiosity, I searched for Birkenstock insoles, found these and my feet have never felt better, I'm finally on the road to recovery. I would suggest anything Birkenstock, that are just damn good for your feet!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cira

customer_reviews.title: So happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Birkenstock shoes for years and I was thrilled to see they had inserts I could put into my rain boots. I had tried other brands, but nothing helps my feet better than Birkenstock’s. I think that comes down to the way their shoes and inserts support all four arches rather than one like most others do. I ordered the size my boots are and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cauley

customer_reviews.title: Great choice.  Saved me buying custom orthotics.
customer_reviews.text: I have no cartilage between my talor navicular bone. I’ve had surgery and only received partial relief. When I stand for a long time (required for my job) I’m in excruciating pain. Wear Birkenstock sandals alleviates most of this pain. But I was stuck wearing sandals every day. These insoles fit perfectly and give my arch the support needed. I think the toe ridge helps support by bad foot too. I wore regular athletic shoes all day yesterday with these in them and was able to go 7-8 hours with minimal pain (a huge win for me). I love them.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Relief for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Finally an arch support that helps my plantar fasciitis! These are way better than Superfeet and a great alternative to orthotics from the podiatrist (and $400 less!). I have severe plantar fasciitis and these reduce my pain significantly. The support hits my arch in the exact spot. I use these in a pair of Hokas for hiking and backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: SierraRunner

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical at first, pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe all the good reviews these insoles received. But the other day I put them in my boots and walked on concrete floors for about 2.5 hours. And guess what?! They were just like wearing my Birkenstock clogs ! I was thrilled because I didn't have to give up wearing my other shoes with these insoles in them. It is important to stick the blue part to the cork bottom with the adhesive disks that come with the insoles so that they stay put when you put your shoes on with the insoles inside, otherwise you're going to suffer in the worst way.
customer_reviews.author: Randabella

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Footbed Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Now I can buy any pair of shoes instead of being limited to Birkenstock styles which are rarely updated. These insoles have opened up my shoe buying possibilities and I could not be happier! If you love Birkenstocks, you NEED these insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, perfect feel
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Birks for years and am frequently disappointed with other shoes. I needed an insole for a hiking shoe as my feet were aching. When I saw that Birkenstock made them, I bought them despite the high price. These are beyond perfect. My feet are so happy with these! I am sure I will be buying these for as long as they are made.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L.

customer_reviews.title: They dont support your feet like your sandals or clogs. Very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Not only do these not feel like your sandals or clogs but they're not even as supportive as the Keene insoles that came with the shoes that I used them in. After my first day in these I was so relieved to take them off. I'd feel better about stuffing a wet rag into my shoes before a hike than these insoles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like hard and not soft insoles
customer_reviews.text: I like hard and not soft insoles. I am looking for support vs. cushioning. These fit the bill perfectly. I have tried multiple times to wear Birkenstock shoes, but they ALWAYS hurt my feet and I found them generally uncomfortable. I popped a pair of these into my Merrill Ventilators and life is wonderful. They are very comfortable and fit the shoe well. The blue insole does provide a bit of cushioning, but the cork 1/2 soles are the meat of this offering.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: I’ve bought so many others brands , this is what I’m sticking with going forward.
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research the conclusion is in... I’m on my feet all day and have tried so many other brands. I’ve been moving these between my pairs of work shoes and boots and they make a huge comfort difference . I just ordered 2 more pairs . Very sturdy also washable to keep fresh😃
customer_reviews.author: cindy v

customer_reviews.title: sticky
customer_reviews.text: The blue part of this was too sticky. I couldn't slide my foot into the shoe becuase it would grab the sock and then the area over the toe was strained. In the end, I believe these ended up going to goodwill which sucks because they're not cheap. I use the other types of birkenstock orthotics, with the blue cloth, and also the leather, and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy W.

customer_reviews.title: These aren't like the sandals
customer_reviews.text: These don't form to your feet like Birks do. They have stayed hard and not broke down at all and I've had them 3 months. They hurt more than help, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Hogjawz

customer_reviews.title: Great for plantar fasciitis sufferers
customer_reviews.text: These insoles are wonderful. I am dealing with a long term battle with plantar fasciitis and have tried many exercises, inserts, methods to deal with this. I really hate to give up daily walking and hiking which was what most of the recommendations are. These inserts are wonderful. I'm able to move them from shoe to shoe and continue activity without the expected worsening of the pf condition which usually results. They do take a little manuevering to fit them perfectly into some of my walking or hiking shoes, but it's really not a big deal once I figured it out. I'm very happy with this purchase and recommed these to everyone whether dealing with pf or not.
customer_reviews.author: ln512

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are fantastic. They greatly reduce foot discomfort. nothing else works that I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to my flat feet, but order EU size from your shoe!
customer_reviews.text: love em! I don't hardly go a day with out putting these in my boots & shoes. I have very flat feet & over-pronate. These give my feet the support needed with out over jacking my arch witch over corrects my issue & leaves my feet very tired. I am on my feet most of the day & often am on the go for 12-14 hrs. Beware to order based on YOUR SHOES EU sizing & not Birk's conversion chart which is way off! My 12 1⁄2 Mens is a size 47 & is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed....
customer_reviews.text: I love wearing Birkenstock shoes. Now I need more arch support. I was hoping these arch supports would do the job. As I walk they slide out the back of my shoe! I ordered the same size and my shoe size....
customer_reviews.author: Kansas lady

customer_reviews.title: These are great. the heelcup only ones are good for walking ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. the heelcup only ones are good for walking and work shoes, but these have been pretty solid for activities. Perfect for golf and have worked well for indoor soccer. no sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: SouthSideKing

customer_reviews.title: Super uncomfortable. Bought for my super birkis
customer_reviews.text: Super uncomfortable. Bought for my super birkis. On my feet all day. These caused a lot of discomfort. Returned for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: jordin tillison

customer_reviews.title: Best Orthotics money can buy
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the best orthotics you can use for bad feet. Anything Birkenstock makes will greatly improve foot health. I have tried custom orthotics & they are molded to your foot in an unnatural position making them tough to wear. Having tried 3 foot doctors, 3 orthotics with no relief, I turned to Birkenstock & have been wearing their sandals & orthotics for 10 yrs. Start with a good quality shoe like Merrill's or New Balance, as no orthotic will work properly in poor quality shoes. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: I took out the cushion and wore with the blue covers and I am happy with the relief I get from a Planters fasciitis ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought they would be to hard to wear all day so I tried to wear them with cushion insoles and they made my shoes to tight and the top of my feet hurt. I took out the cushion and wore with the blue covers and I am happy with the relief I get from a Planters fasciitis I have suffered with for 2 years now. Not a 100 % but I will take all I can get.
customer_reviews.author: D.Powell

customer_reviews.title: Birkenstock Quality
customer_reviews.text: The inserts are typical Birkenstock quality. I wear Birkenstock sandals and like them but these don't seem to feel as good in shoes and the sandals. Don't believe it is the fault of Birkenstock or design, just something my feet don't like. Others may get better results.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price if you love your birks.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these in Keen work boots. Closest thing I've found to steel toed Birkenstocks. The blue section doesn't supply cushion, it holds the orthotic in place. For cushion I layer these on top of a thin flat insole.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: pain reliever
customer_reviews.text: Foot pain was getting worse and my husband couldn't walk on treadmill anymore. After putting insoles in gym shoes, he had a big smile and working out on treadmill like he used to. Awesome. Bought 2 more pairs to upgrade comfort in dress shoes.
customer_reviews.author: compugirl

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: The cork insoles do not feel like they do on the sandals. I switched them and it still feels as if the arch support was on the outer side of my foot. I'll keep trying to find a shoe it works with because I've used it but stick with the original Birkenstocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste money on other inserts
customer_reviews.text: These make my regular shoes feel so good and really help my plantar fasciitis pain. They’re expensive, so for now I plan to shift the one pair between shoes. But I wish I hadn’t wasted money on all the other inserts!
customer_reviews.author: L. Davison

customer_reviews.title: Top of cork insole hits my foot in a bad spot.
customer_reviews.text: I have recently had to start wearing Birkenstock sandals due to plantar fascitis, and was hoping that these would allow me to wear my regular shoes. They are mostly very comfortable, with two problems - the area under the ball of the foot is too thin, not enough padding, and the top edge of the cork footbed causes a painful lump on the outside of my foot and in under the little toe. I would probably wear these if not for that, but they are going back as there doesn't seem to be any way to adjust them.
customer_reviews.author: Janine Ohmer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the same as a Birkenstock sandal
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find that the lumpy places on these don't exactly match the lumpy places in my two pairs of Birkenstock sandals. As a result, they don't feel as good in my shoes as wearing my regular Birks feel. I'm going to keep using them, but I'm unlikely to buy another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Grey

customer_reviews.title: No more pain
customer_reviews.text: I added this insole to a pair of Merrill hiking shoes and wow, no pain, even after longer hikes. Pricey, but then how can you put a price on pain relief. I general have issued with ball of foot pain turning most shoes into torture devices. Like the Birkenstock shoes, these insoles provide the same support in the right places.
customer_reviews.author: T. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Love the Birk Products.
customer_reviews.text: Always have used birkenstock insoles, as they are of excellent construction and duriable material. Not my first pair and will not be my last. Use in my sport shoes as well as dress shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Gaberdiel

customer_reviews.title: really great product at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: really great product at a reasonable price. I like it so much i ended up purchasing a second set. it basically cured my Plantar fasciitis in just a few short weeks. i would recommend this to anyone suffering like i was, i could hardly walk anymore particularly in the morning
customer_reviews.author: Guido Brusa

customer_reviews.title: So worth the money! No more foot pain from collapsed arches
customer_reviews.text: Husband couldn’t walk without pain in his Olikai shoes because of collapsed arches, and those are expensive shoes! Well these insoles did the trick! Ordered two pairs and no more pain!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Gundy

customer_reviews.title: Order with caution...
customer_reviews.text: First box arrived opened and missing cork inserts. Second cuz arrived opened and obviously used. At this price, it shouldn't be too much to expect a new product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Fit and quality as expected
customer_reviews.text: Typical of Birkenstock products this two part support is a great match for helping with foot problems. My feet like the Birkenstock foot bed and I'm quite happy to have found these to use in my walking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Violetnut

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for me
customer_reviews.text: I developed a pretty nasty case of plantar fasciitis early this summer and have had trouble finding anything that gives relief. These seem to help in the heel area but cause pain in my outer forefoot. I have long (14), narrow (B), fairly flat feet. They didn't adjust to the shape of my foot to the extent I thought they would, and I find that these put way too much pressure on my metatarsals, and prevent my weight from being evenly distributed on my feet. They're ok, but I wouldn't invest in another pair. I'd return them of I hadn't worn them for a month.
customer_reviews.author: L. Heffay

customer_reviews.title: Should probably only be used in Birkenstock shoes
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to find the right shoe that this will fit into. It is so wide at the base as most Birkenstocks are it does not translate into non-Birkenstock shoes
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Northrup

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! The best there is.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 pairs of these innersoles because like a lot of people Birkenstock sandals were the only shoes I could wear that would support my arch. These innersoles are truly awesome and I even threw out my $1000 custom made orthotics. I have a pair in my hiking boots, dress shoes, work shoes, running shoes and all function really well and support my very fallen arch. They are expensive however, you get what you pay for and these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Run smaller than sandals
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in the same size as my regular Birkenstock sandals. I thought I could use them in my gym shoes for similar support and comfort as my sandals, but alas, they seem to run smaller than my sandals and I should have sized up. Unfortunately, the size up was not available so I'll never know how well they would have worked. I'd recommend sizing up.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Best insoles ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Total game changer. When I got them initially they were hurting my toes because I have odd shaped feet. These insoles made everything right. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dain Sprayberry

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for fallen arches
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by my doctor, from my arches have fallen. And right now it's wonderful it's helping my feet a lot. And the price is the best
customer_reviews.author: Ms M

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am loving these inserts. For the first time in 2 years I was able to walk 4 miles without sore feet. The rest of me was like "what the heck did you just do?" but I don't care. It felt so good to just take a long walk without worrying about the pain and discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No arch support...not like birk sandals...do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping to add the kind of fit and support that Birk Sandals provide...these are NOT that...DO NOT BUY THESE THEY ARE AWFUL! They have no arch support and are very uncomfortable. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: D Fish

customer_reviews.title: Keeps getting better!
customer_reviews.text: These get better every day. Just like the sandals it takes time to get them to form to your feet. Once they do, it's heaven. People who have Birks know, if you haven't just wait. These are better than the ones made by my Orthopedist. My PF is kept at bay now, finally! Thank you Birks!!!
customer_reviews.author: RSG

customer_reviews.title: Might want to size down a bit
customer_reviews.text: I love my Birkenstock sandals but did not like the feel these inserts. I ordered my regular size but did not work well in my New Balance shoes. Also the packaging was torn and they looked like they had been used. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Lori T. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Helped my plantar issues!
customer_reviews.text: Great insole for plantar fasciitis! Nothing else worked for me. This is my second set for my other pair of shoes. Really does work, I guarantee it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Nieves

customer_reviews.title: A little thin
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving 4 stars because they are really thin don’t see how the support can work if it has give my other birk insoles are very sturdy so I tried these not as impressed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost turns non-Birkenstocks into Birkenstocks.
customer_reviews.text: These take up a certain amount of room, but not as much as I'd expected. I was able to use them in boots and sneakers (after taking out the existing insoles), and if your shoes are too big, these would probably make them about a size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This will be the second pair I've had to buy in about 6 years. Excellent product. Supports arch like no other insole I've tried yet, and I've tried a lot! Wears good, solid feel, doesn't sag like other "formed" or "molded" insoles. Take it from a 6'-3" 240lb man with flat feet; these insoles are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Michel R Bernier

customer_reviews.title: They really do help.
customer_reviews.text: After reading favorable reviews from other Amazon customers I decided to try these insoles. They really do help. I noticed immediately that the strike point on my heels was changed during power-walking. It moved from the back of the heel to near the front. It relieved the pain during exercise and enable me to wear shoes again for work that I hadn't been able to wear for months. While the pain hasn't completely disappeared as of yet, it is certainly less intense.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Young

customer_reviews.title: These is nice.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these inserts, the problem is that my feet really overpronate a lot, but a lot, I feel more support, but not what I really needed, I hope at least last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: adriana griffin

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I have five pairs of barks, all size 38, these insole seem just tiny bit short. I can feel the end at the tips of my toes. They feel wonderful in my sneakers, I was about at the point where I had to walk in my dress shoes because my feet hurt so much in my sneakers (even with arch support insoles), since I got these my feet are feeling much better. I am looking forward to trying them in other shoes!
customer_reviews.author: A mom in Nebraska

customer_reviews.title: Foot pain gone. Fit perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I have been fighting foot pain for some time now. X-rays show heal spurs on both feet. I went to these in all of my shoes and the pain in gone while I have them on. The other day I wore a different shoe that didn't have themuch in it and my feet hurt that day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great support for my feet. Well made!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for the last 5 years. Great support for my feet. I actually just use the arch part because its a better fit in my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: sarah axelrod

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support--love the fit and comfort this insole offers ...
customer_reviews.text: Great arch support--love the fit and comfort this insole offers my feet. With the insole I can walk and stand for much longer periods of time without having my feet and legs hurt. Highly recommend them to anyone with arch support issues. I can even wear cheap shoes with these inserts. Gone are the days of having to pay over $100 for a pair of shoes that I still need to use with an insert!
customer_reviews.author: Brady McManus

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking
customer_reviews.text: Feels just like a Birkenstock sandal which is the only shoe I can wear due to a Morton’s neuroma. Birkenstock enclosed shoes don’t have the sandal footbed. So these insole fit beautifully into my Keen’s and feel great. Thank goodness as winter is coming!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Brandt

customer_reviews.title: The Berkenstok orthotics are wonderful. My feet are so much better at the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet at work for many hours each day. Ihad gotten orthotics from my podiatrist to help my plantar fasciitis, but by the end of the day My feet throbbed in pain. The Berkenstok orthotics are wonderful. My feet are so much better at the end of my work day. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: jerseyc1

customer_reviews.title: Thru Hiker Game Changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best piece of gear I purchased for a thru hike on the Appalachian trail. I hiked over 1600 miles in these. I was doing 8 to 12 mile days with a 40lb pack before I got them. After... i was doing 16 to 25 with 32.6 miles being my longest day. After about 15 to 20 miles, my feet started feeling fatigue. HUGE DIFFERENCE!!
customer_reviews.author: Pops Ganoot

customer_reviews.title: Very good arch support
customer_reviews.text: Very good arch support, but seem to be getting a sore spot on the edge of my right foot. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent supports.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the traditional Birkenstock Insert for 15 years and saw these on Amazon and thought I'd try them. I actually like them better than my traditional arc supports and I did not think that was possible.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I might just say that these are the best insoles ever made
customer_reviews.text: I might just say that these are the best insoles ever made!! It took my feet about an hour to adjust to them, after that I didn't want to take my boots off. I will be buying more so I can have these in all of my shoes, I will be buying them for my wife's shoes as well!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of noise
customer_reviews.text: The insoles fit as you would expect a Birkenstock’s I sole to fit. However, it squeaks!! The cork underside, coupled with the insole itself makes the whole shoe squeak when you walk! Ugh!!
customer_reviews.author: susanb

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits good. Need to work up to wearing full time. A little bit longer each day. Makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Comfort at last
customer_reviews.text: I struggle with plantar fasciitis. Only my Birkenstocks seem to help. I was very excited to find an athletic insert! They make my walking shoes as comfortable as my sandals. I have walked a lot of miles since putting the inserts in. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Sue S.

customer_reviews.title: Those Germans are doing something right.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I have high arches so this definitely helps give me the proper support. The price tag isn't too steep for Birkenstock technology which is far superior to any custom orthotics! If you have flat feet these may not be suitable.
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo L. Blume

customer_reviews.title: Provide adequate arch support
customer_reviews.text: The insert's arch support is not quite a pronounced as in my Birkenstock sandals, but they still provide enough support that I am able to walk around 3 miles during my normal evening walking routine and not have my feet killing me by the end. I ordered the exact same size as my Birkenstock sandals and they fit in my 14 "wide" walking shoes just fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. N. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This ous my second pair. I replace the insoles in my tennis shoes with them and makes my daily walks much more comfortable. Have recommended to others and they agree!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my New Balance sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I stand for hours at work. I added these to my New Balance sneakers and they made a big difference. Glad I found them. I love Birkenstock shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy  J Cordwell

customer_reviews.title: Sizing doesn’t make sense
customer_reviews.text: my previous experience with these insoles was very positive. But have given up this time due to sizing issues. The sizes listed by Birkenstock are wildly inconsistent with the “standards” available. I gave up after two attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Saganich

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but not like wearing Birkenstock sandals.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my feel only feel comfortable in a Birkenstock or similar shoe. I bought the insoles to put inside my winter boots. My boots are a women's size 9 1/2 but I wear a 41 (size 10) in Birkenstocks. I was a bit afraid that the insoles would be too large for the boots, but they worked. I like the arch support, but there is not the same support for the toes that Birkenstock sandals have, which was why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Outside foot area of the insole is too elevated (for me).
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: These are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I use them with all by shoes, boots etc. great arch and impact support! I replace the insole that comes with the shoes with these.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Helped with my plantars!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine that also suffered with plantars recommended these to put in my running shoes. I have high arches and narrow feet. They have worked wonderfully to help relieve pain while standing 8 plus hours at my job and I've been able to start back running again. I'm up to running 7 miles with no pain. I now have 2 pair: one for running and one for work shoes. Best money I've spent!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S.

customer_reviews.title: Eh not great
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Am actually disappointed. Keep hearing how awesome this brand is. So much money for my feet to be killing me at the end of shift :/
customer_reviews.author: Cody Burr

customer_reviews.title: A little pricy, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I can't wait to get into these after a day at work. I suffer from plantar fasciitis and they seem to help
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hersey

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I debated a long time purchasing these supports because of the price, but once I finally ordered them, I have never been happier. They fit great, transfer easily to several different pairs of shoes, and make walking a joy again! They are just what I need for my closed shoes so that I can have good arch support and comfortable feet.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret G

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Very similar to the classic Arizona footbed
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Very similar to the classic Arizona footbed. You can turn all your other shoes into your Birkenstock sandals. Its really a blessing for my knees.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd pair!
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. They are way less money than the custom inserts, and they are also consistent. My old custom ones always had to be modified and thus no 2 were ever the same. I sometimes up an air pillow insole underneath as they don't have much (if any) cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Peters

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen arches and these insoles work very well. When I first put them into my shoes they felt weird because they aren't like other insoles. I very quickly fell in love with them because I can go up and down stairs without knee pain! I can be on my feet for hours without having my low back start to ache.
customer_reviews.author: T Miller

customer_reviews.title: Weird but good
customer_reviews.text: Felt strange at first on the ball but are comfortable to wear. My sister liked them too and got some for herself. I have a terrible time getting comfortable shoes and am discovering that putting expensive :-( insoles like these into ordinary shoes is the only way to go. I also like Aetrex, which comes with a choice of support corrections.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Insole
customer_reviews.text: They are so comfortable. I have spent so much wasted money on insoles and this is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: G. Butler

customer_reviews.title: I put these in Doc Marten's and I love them! I work at a restaurant and am ...
customer_reviews.text: I put these in Doc Marten's and I love them! I work at a restaurant and am on my feet up to twelve hours a day and with these inserts I feel little foot fatigue from the day. Great support but would probably be too stiff for me when used for activities such as running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Relief for my feet!
customer_reviews.text: As someone whose feet are only comfortable in my Birkenstock sandals I decided to try these inserts. Boy, am I glad I did! They fir perfectly in my athletic shoes and feel fantastic! They are far superior to my expensive orthopedic insoles!!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Lehrer

customer_reviews.title: ... and adding this sole for my sport shoes is wonderful because it really cuts down on the "sliding" that ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear the full birkenstock 3/4 support in my shoes due to plantar faschiatis and adding this sole for my sport shoes is wonderful because it really cuts down on the "sliding" that occurs on the cork sole. Love these blue sport insoles. Wish the cork portion was as full arched as the other insoles from Birkenstocks!
customer_reviews.author: EV

customer_reviews.title: Transforms cheap shoes into comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These have transformed a lot of my cheap flats into shoes I can comfortably stand in all day. I have found that the blue piece does not fit in a lot of my shoes, but the important part is the other part and those fit in about 90% of my shoes. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Neidig

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky
customer_reviews.text: Great support, similar to birks but SO SQUEAKY in my shoes. I’ve had to change into other shoes sometimes because I just can’t take it. It’s distracting. Need to try in a different pair of shoes, hoping for some quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Birkenstock Birko Sport Arch Support - Sport
product_meta.description:
* Birkenstock® Size and Width Chart
 * Please be advised that the Birkenstock® Narrow width can accommodate both traditional narrow and medium widths.
 * The Birko Sport Arch Support - Sport system provides support and cushioning when you need it the most!
 * This two-part arch support system is made specifically for sports shoes. 
 * The blue foam insole retains memory of your foot providing all-day comfort.
 * The cork heel cup forces your foot in the proper alignment and helps keep the padding under the heel bone for cushioning on impact.
 * Hand wash lightly with mild detergent. 
 * Made in Germany.
feature_bullets: Two-part system includes arch support and shock-absorbing EVA foam top layer.
Metatarsal pad provides extra cushioning under the ball of foot.
Compressed foam heel cup absorbs shock, while helping stabilize the foot.
BirkoCork (cork and EVA), BirkoCell EVA liner.
